fullText: The show's one saving grace is its heart, which beats strong and true throughout this homespun tale of a prodigal son who returns to his blue-collar New Jersey hometown to save his mother's house from foreclosure.
dtliExcerpt: The show's one saving grace is its heart, which beats strong and true throughout this homespun tale of a prodigal son who returns to his blue-collar New Jersey hometown to save his mother's house from foreclosure.
bwwExcerpt: Although simplistic by design, the script is funny without being hilarious, grooving along mainly on its many goofy throwaway lines. One nonsensical exchange reveals that Sharon once had a thing with Aerosmith's renowned lead guitarist, Joe Perry, and was the inspiration for "Back in the Saddle." "Oh, grow up," Sharon scolds her scandalized son. "So, your mom was into S&M - so what?"
